2.2.5. Lab – Creating an APM Policy¶

2.2.5.1. Task – Review the APM Policy Created by the PUA Build Script¶

2.2.5.2. Task – Add Ondemand Certifcate Authentication¶

  1. Create a macro called CAC AUTH

  1. Add On-demand Cert Auth to the new macro. Leave the Auth Mode to Request.

  2. Add the GET UPN from CAC to the macro

  3. Update the terminal to show Success and Failure

2.2.5.3. Task – Create an LDAP macro¶

  1. Create a macro called LDAP Query

  2. Add the LDAP Query operator to the macro

  3. Select the predefined LDAP Server f5lab, and input the SearchDN and SearchFilter. Select Fetch groups Direct

    SearchDN     = DC=f5lab,DC=local
SearchFilter  = UserPrincipalName=%{session.custom.ephemeral.upn}

  4. Delete User Group Membership branch

  5. Add a new Branch called Passed which check if the LDAP query Passed

  6. Update the terminals for the LDAP query by clicking edit terminals

  7. Add the LDAP Query Marco to the CAC AUTH macro by clicking the plus sign be side the GET UPN from CAC macro

2.2.5.4. Task – Update the default start Branch¶

  1. Remove the logon Page by clicking the X above the Logon Page

  2. Add the CAC AUTH macro between the Warning Banner and Variable Assign

  3. Change the LDAP Query terminal from Success to Failure by clicking the terminal

  4. Update the Variables Assign

  5. Click Apply Access Policy
